Internal Auditor Job at Mopheth Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Mopheth Pharmaceutical Nigeria Limited is people and customer focused organization, we thrive to attain excellence and perfection at all times.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Auditor

Job Location: Victoria Island & Lekki, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Plan and conduct internal audits across departments and business units.
	Review financial, operational, and compliance processes to identify gaps and risks.
	Ensure adherence to company policies, statutory laws, and regulatory requirements.
	Provide recommendations to improve efficiency, safeguard assets, and ensure financial accuracy.
	Prepare clear audit reports and present findings to management.
	Monitor the implementation of corrective actions and follow-up audits.


Qualifications & Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of experience as an Internal Auditor or in a similar role.
	Professional certifications such as ACA, ACCA, or CIA (an added advantage).
	Strong knowledge of auditing standards, accounting principles, and internal control systems.
	Excellent analytical, communication, and report-writing skills.
	High level of integrity, objectivity, and attention to detail.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrmopheth@gmail.com using "Application for Internal Auditor” as the subject of the email.

Administrative Assistant Job at  University of Lagos African Multiple Research Centre (AMRC)




        
    

        
        The University of Lagos African Multiple Research Centre (AMRC) is a centre within the Institute of African and Diaspora Studies (IADS), a reputable research institute at the University of Lagos, committed to advancing excellence in cutting-edge research and innovation.

Applications are invited from suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract (3years)

Position Summary
     

            
    




	The Centre is seeking a highly organized and proactive Administrative Assistant to join our team.
	The ideal candidate for the post should normally possess 5 Credits, including English and Mathematics at one sitting (SSCE/WASSCE).
	He/She will provide essential administrative support to ensure the smooth operation of daily activities within the organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Handle day-to-day administrative tasks to support office operations.
	Maintain accurate filing systems (physical and electronic) for easy retrieval of documents.
	Provide clerical support including typing, photocopying, and scanning documents.
	Maintain confidentiality and uphold organizational policies at all times.
	Assist in scheduling meetings, preparing agendas, and maintaining records.


Qualifications & Experience


	5 Credits, including English and Mathematics at one siting (WASSCE/SSCE or equivalent) is required.
	Proficiency in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work with minimal supervision.
	High level of integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should ubmit an application letter, a comprehensive curriculum vitae, names and addresses of three (3) referees and copies of relevant credentials to:
Deputy Director,
Institute of African and Diaspora Studies (DD/IADS),
J.P. Clark Centre, Behind Senate Building,
University of Lagos,
Akoka, Lagos.
OR
send resume to iads@unilag.edu.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email. E.g "POSITION APPLIED FOR – YOUR NAME IN CAPITAL LETTERS".

Note


	The University of Lagos African Multiple Research Centre (AMRC) is an equal opportunity centre, and Female applicants are particularly encouraged to apply.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Channel Manager & Presenter",
  "description": "StarTimes is one of the fastest growing pay-TV company in Nigeria, since its inception with the largest television body in Africa (N.T.A), Nigerians who have been denied of affordable entertainment, now have unlimited access to enjoyable and affordable pay TV. StarTimes operates on a novel technology; Digital Terrestrial Technology (DTT), first to be recognized and appreciated by Nigerians.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Channel Manager &amp; Presenter

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Responsibilities


	Oversee the daily operations and management of Nigeria&rsquo;s dedicated movie channel, developing and executing content strategies to drive audience growth and channel ratings.
	Lead the planning, production, and review of movie-related programs, ensuring high-quality content that aligns with broadcast standards and audience expectations.
	Serve as the face of the channel by taking on on-camera roles, including interviews, hosting, movie reviews, and voiceovers, strengthening the channel&rsquo;s brand identity.
	Participate in movie specials, celebrity interviews, and industry events, providing professional insights into Nollywood and global cinema trends.
	Coordinate the work of producers, reporters, camera operators, and editors to ensure smooth and efficient program production.
	Monitor ratings data and industry developments, proposing innovative content strategies and promotional initiatives to enhance channel performance and audience engagement.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or above in Media, Journalism, Film Studies, Broadcasting, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in television, movie channels, or new media, with proven experience in channel or program management.
	Passionate about cinema with a strong understanding of the Nollywood industry, capable of shaping content strategies around audience interests and industry trends.
	Skilled in on-camera presentation, interviewing, hosting, and voiceover, with fluent English communication and strong screen presence.
	Solid knowledge of program production and broadcasting workflows, including scripting, interviewing, hosting, and post-production.

Channel Manager & Presenter Job at StarTimes




        
    

        
        StarTimes is one of the fastest growing pay-TV company in Nigeria, since its inception with the largest television body in Africa (N.T.A), Nigerians who have been denied of affordable entertainment, now have unlimited access to enjoyable and affordable pay TV. StarTimes operates on a novel technology; Digital Terrestrial Technology (DTT), first to be recognized and appreciated by Nigerians.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Channel Manager & Presenter

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Oversee the daily operations and management of Nigeria’s dedicated movie channel, developing and executing content strategies to drive audience growth and channel ratings.
	Lead the planning, production, and review of movie-related programs, ensuring high-quality content that aligns with broadcast standards and audience expectations.
	Serve as the face of the channel by taking on on-camera roles, including interviews, hosting, movie reviews, and voiceovers, strengthening the channel’s brand identity.
	Participate in movie specials, celebrity interviews, and industry events, providing professional insights into Nollywood and global cinema trends.
	Coordinate the work of producers, reporters, camera operators, and editors to ensure smooth and efficient program production.
	Monitor ratings data and industry developments, proposing innovative content strategies and promotional initiatives to enhance channel performance and audience engagement.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree or above in Media, Journalism, Film Studies, Broadcasting, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in television, movie channels, or new media, with proven experience in channel or program management.
	Passionate about cinema with a strong understanding of the Nollywood industry, capable of shaping content strategies around audience interests and industry trends.
	Skilled in on-camera presentation, interviewing, hosting, and voiceover, with fluent English communication and strong screen presence.
	Solid knowledge of program production and broadcasting workflows, including scripting, interviewing, hosting, and post-production.
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills, leading a team effectively and delivering under tight deadlines.


Method of Application

Assistant Facility Manager Job at Flinx Realty




        
    

        
        Flinx Realty  - We are a Lekki-centric Real Estate company that specializes in sale and rental of both commercial and residential properties. With our wealth of knowledge in real estate and most importantly the location, we aim to ease the process of acquiring and renting a property in lekki and its environs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Facility Manager

Job Location: Lagos

About the Job
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced and proactive Assistant Facility Manager to support in overseeing the effective operation, safety, and maintenance of our buildings and facilities.
	This role is critical to maintaining operational excellence, managing vendors and budgets, and delivering a seamless experience for guests.
	The ideal candidate is proactive, hands-on, and capable of balancing day-to-day facility operations with long-term planning.


Key Responsibilities


	Support the Facility Manager in overseeing daily facility operations, maintenance, and repairs.
	Assist in coordinating vendors, contractors, and service providers to ensure quality service delivery.
	Contribute to the development and implementation of preventive and corrective maintenance plans.
	Monitor and report on facility expenses, highlighting opportunities for cost-saving.
	Support compliance efforts with safety, health, and environmental regulations.
	Assist with coordinating upgrades, renovations, and improvement projects.
	Respond promptly to facility-related issues and escalate emergencies as needed.


Requirements


	Minimum of 1 - 2 years of experience in facility or property management (experience in a support role is an advantage).
	Relevant certification (e.g., IFMA, OSHA, CFM) is an added advantage.
	Basic knowledge of building systems (electrical, plumbing, HVAC, security).
	Strong organizational, planning, and vendor coordination skills.
	Proficiency in Google Workspace and willingness to learn facility management software.
	Good communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to take initiative under supervision.
